list-item.p: Snakebite incidence shows seasonal variation in Sri Lanka, with the highest incidence during November–December followed by March–May and August.
Lower-than-expected relative humidity in a given season leads to higher snakebite incidence.
Global climate change is likely to increase the snakebite burden in Sri Lanka during next 25–50 years.
This study demonstrates a general approach to addressing the effects of variable survey effort and recall bias associated with epidemiological surveys.
